# resume()

**Instance Method**

Resumes execution of a suspended task.

## Declaration

```swift
func resume() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiver was able to resume execution, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

## Discussion

If the system sent multiple [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/suspend()] messages to the receiver, an equal number of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Process/resume()] messages must be sent before the task resumes execution.

## Running and Stopping

- **run()**: Runs the process with the current environment.
- **interrupt()**: Sends an interrupt signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.
- **suspend()**: Suspends execution of the receiver task.
- **terminate()**: Sends a terminate signal to the receiver and all of its subtasks.
- **waitUntilExit()**: Blocks the process until the receiver is finished.
